As shown in Figure 7c, FEZ and FEA decreased significantly with the temperature increasing up to 2000 K, while the difference DFE (= FEZ-FEA) decreased gradually from 2.854 eV for 0 K down to 2.526 eV for 2000 K. According to the thermodynamics, if a Si atom deposited on this surface has enough time to wander between the two edges, then it will finally locate at the armchair edge because of the lower FE, and five similar Si atoms will form an armchair edge instead of a zigzag one.
